ada_lovelace.name: Ada Lovelace
ada_lovelace.description: Mathematician often recognized as the first computer programmer.

albert_einstein.name: Albert Einstein
albert_einstein.description: Theoretical physicist known for developing the theory of relativity.

amelia_earhart.name: Amelia Earhart
amelia_earhart.description: First female aviator to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.

carl_sagan.name: Carl Sagan
carl_sagan.description: Astronomer and science communicator known for research in extraterrestrial life.

cleopatra.name: Cleopatra
cleopatra.description: Last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt

confucius.name: Confucius
confucius.description: Ancient philosopher who significantly influenced East Asian culture and philosophy.

frida_kahlo.name: Frida Kahlo
frida_kahlo.description: Mexican artist renowned for her symbolic self-portraits.

harriet_tubman.name: Harriet Tubman
harriet_tubman.description: Abolitionist who led hundreds of enslaved people to freedom.

isaac_newton.name: Isaac Newton
isaac_newton.description: Scientist known for his influential contributions to physics, including his laws of motion.

leonardo_da_vinci.name: Leonardo da Vinci
leonardo_da_vinci.description: High Renaissance polymath known for his diverse contributions to multiple fields.

louis_pasteur.name: Louis Pasteur
louis_pasteur.description: French biologist, microbiologist and chemist renowned for his discoveries of the principles of vaccination, microbial fermentation and pasteurization

mahatma_gandhi.name: Mahatma Gandhi
mahatma_gandhi.description: Leader of Indian nationalism who employed nonviolent resistance for independence.

marie_curie.name: Marie Curie
marie_curie.description: Physicist and chemist known for pioneering research on radioactivity.

maya_angelou.name: Maya Angelou
maya_angelou.description: An American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist, she is best known for her series of seven autobiographies, which focus on her childhood and early adult experiences, the first and most famous of which is 'I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings'.

nelson_mandela.name: Nelson Mandela
nelson_mandela.description: Anti-apartheid revolutionary, political leader, and former President of South Africa.

nikola_tesla.name: Nikola Tesla
nikola_tesla.description: Inventor and engineer who greatly contributed to the development of electrical systems.

queen_victoria.name: Queen Victoria
queen_victoria.description: Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland from 1837 until her death

virginia_woolf.name: Virginia Woolf
virginia_woolf.description: Influential English writer and modernist of the 20th century.

zora_neale_hurston.name: Zora Neale Hurston
zora_neale_hurston.description: American author who portrayed racial struggles in the early-20th-century South.

the_easter_bunny.name: The Easter Bunny
the_easter_bunny.description: A folkloric figure and symbol of Easter, depicted as a rabbit bringing Easter eggs

the_tooth_fairy.name: The Tooth Fairy
the_tooth_fairy.description: A fantasy figure of early childhood in Western and Western-influenced cultures

santa_claus.name: Santa Claus
santa_claus.description: A legendary figure originating in Western Christian culture who is said to bring gifts to the homes of well-behaved children on the night of Christmas Eve

robin_hood.name: Robin Hood
robin_hood.description: A heroic outlaw in English folklore who, according to legend, was a highly skilled archer and swordsman

sherlock_holmes.name: Sherlock Holmes
sherlock_holmes.description: A fictional private detective created by British author Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

dracula.name: Dracula
dracula.description: A vampire who is fabled to haunt the Carpathian Mountains

king_arthur.name: King Arthur
king_arthur.description: A legendary British leader who, according to medieval histories and romances, led the defense of Britain against Saxon invaders in the late 5th and early 6th centuries

hermione_granger.name: Hermione Granger
hermione_granger.description: A key character in the Harry Potter series, Harry's best friend, and a talented and intelligent witch

harry_potter.name: Harry Potter
harry_potter.description: The protagonist of J.K. Rowling's fantasy novel series about a young wizard and his adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

james_bond.name: James Bond
james_bond.description: A fictional British secret agent created by writer Ian Fleming, known for his sophistication, gadgets, and thrilling espionage missions

lara_croft.name: Lara Croft
lara_croft.description: The main protagonist of the Tomb Raider video game series, an archaeologist-adventurer who explores ancient tombs and uncovers hidden treasures

atticus_finch.name: Atticus Finch
atticus_finch.description: A fictional character in Harper Lee's novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' a lawyer known for his moral integrity and his defense of a wrongly accused African American man

snow_white.name: Snow White
snow_white.description: The protagonist of the fairy tale and Disney film 'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs,' known for her beauty and kind-hearted nature

alice.name: Alice
alice.description: The central character in Lewis Carroll's 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland,' a young girl who falls into a whimsical and nonsensical world

don_quixote.name: Don Quixote
don_quixote.description: The main character in Miguel de Cervantes' novel 'Don Quixote,' a middle-aged man who sets out on a quest to revive chivalry and battle imaginary foes
